qas.question: What two formats are typically used to recorde non-cinematic HDTV video intended for broadcast?
Which format is typically used for internet distribution of HD video?
Most computer monitors operate in what mode?
1080i, 1080p, and 720p are often used on what kind of disc.
What two formats are typically used to record cinematic HDTV video intended for broadcast?
Which format is typically used for internet distribution of SD video?
No computer monitors operate in what mode?
1080i, 1080p, and 720p are never used on what kind of disc.

context: Non-cinematic HDTV video recordings intended for broadcast are typically recorded either in <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>720p<b5_0/> or 1080i<b4_0/><a0_0/> format as determined by the broadcaster. <a1_0>720p<a1_0/> is commonly used for Internet distribution of high-definition video, because most computer monitors operate in <a2_0><b6_0>progressive-scan<b6_0/><a2_0/> mode. 720p also imposes less strenuous storage and decoding requirements compared to both 1080i and 1080p. 1080p/24, 1080i/30, 1080i/25, and 720p/30 is most often used on <a3_0><b7_0>Blu-ray<b7_0/><a3_0/> Disc.
